SEARCH
Package ie.atu.sw.io

Class OutputDirectoryManager

java.lang.Object
ie.atu.sw.io.AbstractDirectoryManager
ie.atu.sw.io.OutputDirectoryManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
IDirectoryManager
public class OutputDirectoryManager extends AbstractDirectoryManager
Manages directory paths for output, handling the configuration and retrieval of paths where output files are to be stored.

  • Field Summary

  • Constructor Details

    • OutputDirectoryManager

      public OutputDirectoryManager()
      Constructor for OutputDirectoryManager. Initialises the current directory path to a default value and creates the directory if needed. Big-O Notation: O(1) - Initialisation and directory creation are constant-time operations.

  • Method Details

    • configureDirectoryPath

      public String configureDirectoryPath() throws DirectoryConfigurationException
      Configures and sets a new directory path for output files. Allows users to keep the default directory or specify a new one. Big-O Notation: O(n) - The complexity depends on the user input process. Directory validation is O(1).
      Specified by:
      configureDirectoryPath in interface IDirectoryManager
      Specified by:
      configureDirectoryPath in class AbstractDirectoryManager
      Returns:
      The directory path selected or confirmed by the user.
      Throws:
      DirectoryConfigurationException - if path configuration fails.

    • getCurrentDirectoryPath

      public String getCurrentDirectoryPath()
      Retrieves the current directory path where output files are stored. Big-O Notation: O(1) - This method returns a member variable, which is a constant-time operation.
      Specified by:
      getCurrentDirectoryPath in interface IDirectoryManager
      Specified by:
      getCurrentDirectoryPath in class AbstractDirectoryManager
      Returns:
      The current directory path as a String.

    • isValidLexiconPath

      protected boolean isValidLexiconPath(String path)
      Checks whether the provided path is a valid directory path for storing lexicons. A valid path is a writable directory. Big-O Notation: O(1) - Basic file system checks with constant-time complexity.
      Specified by:
      isValidLexiconPath in class AbstractDirectoryManager
      Parameters:
      path - The path to be validated.
      Returns:
      true if the path is a valid directory and writable, false otherwise.

    • getNewDirectoryPathFromUser

      protected String getNewDirectoryPathFromUser()
      Gets a new directory path from the user. Ensures the entered path is not empty. Big-O Notation: O(n) - The complexity depends on the number of times the user inputs a path. Loop continues until a valid path is provided.
      Overrides:
      getNewDirectoryPathFromUser in class AbstractDirectoryManager
      Returns:
      A valid directory path entered by the user.
